name: Thomistic Institute at Berkeley, The
description:
The Thomistic Institute's Campus Chapters program began in 2015, and has since expanded to over 80 campuses worldwide.

 

What are chapters?

Campus Chapters are student led organizations recognized by a university that encourage undergraduate and graduate students to collaborate with each other and with their faculty to develop lectures, events, retreats and programs built upon the intellectual tradition brought about by St. Thomas Aquinas. As a campus chapter in Berkeley, we organize reading groups to facilitate academic discussions in philosophy and theology, lectures given by experts in St. Thomas, and social gatherings to provide a fun and comfortable outlet to discussing the complexities of St. Thomas. We also attend intellectual retreats, each focused on a specified topic as it relates to Thomas Aquinas.

 

Thomistic?

St. Thomas Aquinas stands at the heart of what we do. We believe Aquinas' philosophy and theology facilitates great intellectual discussions and debates. With St. Thomas as our touchstone, our speakers and events open endless possibilities for discussion and growth in intellect! Many speakers are experts not only in areas of Thomistic research, but in philosophy, science, literature, theology, and more.

 

Events

There are many different kinds of events a chapter can organize: select a speaker from our network of academics for a lecture, organize a reading group, or even a student retreat or conference! There are many new and interesting ways to be involved, and we would love to grow our chapter.

Learn more at our website or search for us on social media @calthomisticinstitute to stay updated
summary: The Thomistic Institute at UC Berkeley organizes lectures and student reading groups based upon the Intellectual Tradition in the Middle Ages, specifically the works of St. Thomas Aquinas. Lectures and speaking events are open to the public.
